summary: The Firearm Due Process Protection Act aims to enforce the 60-day deadline for the National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS) to finalize record corrections. It mandates expedited hearings (within 30 days) for challenges to NICS decisions, placing the burden of proof on the respondent (government) to demonstrate an individual's ineligibility to possess firearms. The bill also includes provisions for awarding attorney fees to successful complainants and requires annual reports to Congress on NICS challenges. Finally, it includes a Sense of Congress endorsing due process rights related to the right to bear arms.
